meanings.definition: One who violates or goes against a law, rule, or agreement.
meanings.sent1: The contravener was caught breaking the school rules.
meanings.sent2: The contravener ignored the traffic laws and got a ticket.
meanings.sent3: The contravener thought it was funny to sneak past the security guard.
meanings.sent4: She was a contravener of fashion norms, always wearing mismatched socks.
meanings.sent5: The contravener's actions made him stand out in the crowd.

meanings.definition: To act in opposition to a law, rule, or agreement.
meanings.sent1: He chose to contravene the company policy by sharing confidential information.
meanings.sent2: She contravened the terms of the contract by not delivering the goods on time.
meanings.sent3: The cat contravened the house rule of not jumping on the furniture.
meanings.sent4: His decision to contravene the speed limit led to a hefty fine.
meanings.sent5: The storm contravened all safety precautions, causing chaos in the city.
